content.text: My name is *Zeno De Ridder* and I am a 31-years-old, Brussels based artist who's passionate about art and storytelling. I've always been interested n experimenting with different ways to tell stories and I love to design unconventional visual styles to support those stories. Ten years ago I got my degree in udiovisual arts and since then I've dabbled my toes in many different art disciplines ranging from animation, illustration, film and theater to documentary, music and most recently game development. (Under the name Pixel Potemkin)

I never felt the need to stop and specialize, or rather; I often feel the urge to explore working with different or combined media in new styles and techniques. So when I reflected on which of my works I'd wanted to showcase here, it wasn't easy to choose.

I eventually settled on more or less standalone art pieces that would look nice on the playdate's one-bit screen. These works mostly fall into the category of 'in-between doodling and aimless prototyping' but I still am fond of them and happy to be able to share them here.

content.text: *Fortibus* - I picked up the habit of drawing and doodling from a young age and continued doing so throughout most of my life. For some time though, I didn't doodle as much anymore because I spent most of my time making drawings and animations for specific projects.

This one, I made a few years back in a period where I wanted to get back into the habit of free-flow doodling. Most of the doodles from this period were more hectic and abstract as I didn't try to structure them in any way. Fortibus was a bit different as I wanted to explore ways to mix this doodle style with more figurative structures and geometry.
I might have been watching Samurai Jack around the time I drew this. I'm getting some Aku vibes!

content.text: A drawing from the same period, but this one's definitely more figurative. I tried to retain the free flowing approach though.

*Austin Serr* is a Los Angeles-based artist whose background is mainly in filmmaking. He is a cinematographer who has shot several feature-length and short films as well as commercials, documentaries, and music videos. He's also had a passion for video games and an interest in game design for years and has decided to finally take the plunge beyond his Super Mario Maker roots to make his first game with *Eye to Eye*.
